properties.pname: Trans-Pecos Tertiary Alkaline Rocks, New Mexico
properties.affiliatio: New Mexico Bureau of Geology and Mineral Resources
properties.pdescrip: The New Mexico Bureau of Geology and Mineral Resources will map in the Cornudas Mountains in Trans-Pecos area, southern New Mexico in a coordinated effort between the Texas Bureau of Economic Geology and USGS to characterize the evolution and mineral res
properties.pkeyword: beryllium; gold; niobium; chemical analysis; rare earth elements; silver; uranium; zirconium; geologic maps; study areas; geochemistry; igneous rocks
properties.abstract: The New Mexico Bureau of Geology and Mineral Resources will map in the Cornudas Mountains in Trans-Pecos Tertiary alkaline magmatic province of southern New Mexico. The Cornudas Mountains are located in southern Otero County, New Mexico and northern Huspeth County, Texas. The igneous rocks in the Cornudas Mountains were emplaced at or during the beginning of Rio Grande rift extension (~33-36 Ma) and consist of ten larger sills, plugs, and laccoliths and smaller dikes and plugs, which intrude relatively flat-lying limestones and other sedimentary rocks of the Permian Hueco Limestone and Bone Spring Limestone. Compositionally, the igneous rocks in the Cornudas Mountains are classified as alkaline, ferroan, metaluminous to peralkaline and plot as A-type, within-plate granites. The alkaline igneous rocks exhibit typical light-REE-enriched chondrite-normalized patterns. The mapping will help define the geologic framework for areas with potential economic deposits of REE-Zr-Nb (±U, Be) epithermal veins and breccia deposits. In addition, the area has potential of several other types of mineral deposits, including nepheline syenite for ceramics and sand blasting, and Au, Ag, Be, Nb, and U veins. One goal of the effort is to better characterize the igneous system and associated mineralization and alteration regionally in order to assess the economic potential throughout the Cornudas Mountains. This is a coordinated project being conducted in concert with the Texas Bureau of Economic Geology, which is mapping the Cornudas Mountain in Texas, and the USGS Mineral Resources Program, which is acquiring a new airborne magnetic and radiometric survey of the region, all of which are supported by Earth MRI.
properties.alias: Trans-Pecos tertiary alkaline Rocks, New Mexico

A group of elements including the lanthanoids, or lanthanides, of interest because they are used in modern technological industries.  Yttrium and scandium are often included in this group.

Maps depicting geological characteristics of the earth's surface, including lithology, geologic structure, age, and the results of crustal processes. Used where the product includes a depiction of the map as a whole, not for data sets that could be used to create a map.
Geospatial data describing the areas from which samples were taken or observations were made, typically polygonal.  May be approximate, as in bounding coordinates, or precise.
Study of the distribution of chemical elements and natural compounds on the earth and in the atmosphere and the chemical processes that affect the earth.
Rocks formed from melted rock that has cooled and solidified.
A sedimentary rock consisting chiefly (more than 50% by weight or by areal percentages under the microscope) of calcium carbonate, primarily in the form of the mineral calcite...
A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 20 and 60% and P/(A+P) between 10 and 65%
A plutonic rock that contains more sodium and/or potassium than is required to form feldspar with the available silica.
A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having F/(F+A+P) between 10 an 60%, and P/(P+A) < 50%; composed essentially of alkali feldspar and nepheline...

data_link.title: Geochemical data generated by projects funded by the USGS Earth Mapping Resources Initiative
data_link.descript: Includes all geochemical data generated by each project partnership funded through Earth MRI and will be updated periodically as additional geochemical data from these projects becomes available.
